intro: Senecio pyrolifolius, commonly known as the pyrola-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Senecio pyrolifolius is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
